task.title: Conditional profiling
task.shortdesc: DITA allows conditional profiling. It's possible to use conditional profiling "out of the box" using the computer documentation defaults. Any more advanced profiling will require specialization of the DITA Open Toolkit.

section.title: The default come from the computer documentation tradition
section.p: In order to conditionally-filter content using your own profiling attributes, you're going to have to specialise the DITA open toolkit. This means edit a few lines in a text file, and create a new text file as well. It's not pleasant, but it's useful because you can them filter out content to suit. This can minimise the number of actual files you need to maintain.

section.title: Use the DITA Map Manager
section.p: To enable integration with Subject Scheme maps (and other features like "Search References" for conrefs, keep your top level map open in DITA Maps Manager. (Open the window is Window Show View DITA Maps Manager . (You'll need to do this even if you've opened up the top level map in Author mode.
